data.title: In pics: Bipasha Basu gets ready to exchange wedding vows with Karan Singh Grover
data.meta_description: Even as pre-wedding festivities kept the actress busy, she did manage to post a few pictures of a puja on Instagram.
data.text:
Synopsis

Even as pre-wedding festivities kept the actress busy, she did manage to post a few pictures of a puja on Instagram.

Actress Bipasha Basu is all set to tie the knot with beau Karan Singh Grover on Saturday. The duo was spotted all decked up for their mehendi ceremony at a lounge in Mumbai today.

Bipasha Basu at her mehendi ceremony (Image: Instagram)

A traditional Bengali ritual 'briddhi' was held at her residence on Thursday, with the actress's father Hirak Basu performing the ceremony.

Bipasha Basu with her father Hirak Basu during 'briddhi'

Even as pre-wedding festivities kept the 'Jism' actress busy, she did manage to post a few pictures of a puja on Instagram.

Bipasha Basu with Karan Singh Grover (Image: Instagram)

Dressed in a pink sari, Basu posed with Grover who looked dapper in a white kurta.

Bipasha Basu with her gift basket (Image: Instagram)

The festivities were attended by designer Rocky S, producer Suzanne Dadhich, and fitness expert Deanne Pandey who later shared the images on her Instagram account.

Rocky S, Deanne Panday, Suzanne Dadhich, Bipasha Basu and Karan Singh Grover (Image: Instagram)

The couple will exchange vows in an intimate ceremony attended by close family and friends at a suburban Mumbai hotel, followed by a dinner party.

Karan Singh Grover (Image: Instagram)

Basu and Grover had met during the shooting of their film 'Alone', and have been in a relationship ever since.

Bipasha Basu posing with friends (Image: Instagram)

This is the third marriage for Grover, who was previously married to Jennifer Winget and Shraddha Nigam.

(Image: Instagram)

Puja at Bipasha Basu's residence (Image: Instagram)

Also read: When the marriage happens, people will come to know: Bipasha Basu

Also read: Bipasha Basu to tie the knot with Karan Singh Grover on April 30
